name: Titanium.XML.Element
summary: Represents an element in a DOM document, a Titanium.XML.Node defined by a start-tag and end-tag (or an empty tag). Elements may have Titanium.XML.Attr associated with them. Implements the DOM Level 2 API on Android and iOS with some non-standard extensions.

methods.name: getAttribute
methods.summary: Retrieves an attribute value by name, returning it as a string.

parameters.name: name
parameters.summary: The name of the attribute

returns.summary: The Titanium.XML.Attr value as a string, or empty string if the attribute has no specified or default value.

methods.name: getAttributeNode
methods.summary: Retrieves an attribute value by name, returning it as a Titanium.XML.Attr object.

parameters.name: name
parameters.summary: The name of the attribute

returns.summary: The Titanium.XML.Attr value, or null if there is no such attribute.

methods.name: getAttributeNodeNS
methods.summary: Retrieves an attribute value by local name and namespace URI, returning it as a Titanium.XML.Attr object.

parameters.name: namespaceURI
parameters.summary: The namespace URI of the attribute to retrieve.

parameters.name: localName
parameters.summary: The local name of the attribute to retrieve.

returns.summary: The Titanium.XML.Attr value, or null if there is no such attribute.

methods.name: getAttributeNS
methods.summary: Retrieves an attribute value by local name and namespace URI, returning it as a string.

parameters.name: namespaceURI
parameters.summary: The namespace URI of the attribute to retrieve.

parameters.name: localName
parameters.summary: The local name of the attribute to retrieve.

returns.summary: The Titanium.XML.Attr value as a string, or empty string if the attribute has no specified or default value.

methods.name: getElementsByTagName
methods.summary: Retrieves a Titanium.XML.NodeList of all descendant elements with a given tag name, in preorder traversal.

parameters.name: name
parameters.summary: The name of the element. The value * matches all tags.

methods.name: getElementsByTagNameNS
methods.summary: Retrieves a Titanium.XML.NodeList of all descendant elements with a given local name and namespace URI, in preorder traversal.

parameters.name: namespaceURI
parameters.summary: The namespace URI of the element. The value * matches all namespaces.

parameters.name: localName
parameters.summary: The local name of the element. The value * matches all local names.

methods.name: hasAttribute
methods.summary: Determines whether or not an attribute with the given name is available in the element, or has a default value.

parameters.name: name
parameters.summary: The name of the attribute to search for.

methods.name: hasAttributeNS
methods.summary: Determines whether or not an attribute with the given name is available in the element, or has a default value.

parameters.name: namespaceURI
parameters.summary: The namespace URI of the attribute to search for.

parameters.name: localName
parameters.summary: The local name of the attribute to search for.

methods.name: removeAttribute
methods.summary: Removes an attribute by name. If the attribute has a default value, it is immediately replaced with this default, including namespace URI and local name. Throws an exception if the element is read-only.

parameters.name: name
parameters.summary: The name of the attribute to remove.

methods.name: removeAttributeNode
methods.summary: Removes the specified attribute node. If the removed attribute has a default value, it is replaced immediately, with the same namespace and local name as the removed attribute, if applicable. Throws an exception if the element is read-only, or the attribute is not an attribute of the element.

parameters.name: oldAttr
parameters.summary: The attribute to remove.

methods.name: removeAttributeNS
methods.summary: Removes an attribute by local name and namespace URI. If the attribute has a default value, it is immediately replaced with this default, including namespace URI and local name. Throws an exception if the element is read-only.

parameters.name: namespaceURI
parameters.summary: The namespace URI of the attribute to remove.

parameters.name: localName
parameters.summary: The local name of the attribute to remove.

methods.name: setAttribute
methods.summary: Adds a new attribute. Any attribute with the same name is replaced. Throws an exception if the element is read-only, or if the name contains an illegal character.

parameters.name: name
parameters.summary: The name of the attribute.

parameters.name: value
parameters.summary: The value of the attribute. This is value is not parsed as part of the assignment. Any markup is treated as literal text, and needs to be escaped.

methods.name: setAttributeNode
methods.summary: Adds a new attribute. Any attribute with the same nodeName as the argument is replaced. Throws an exception if the element is read-only, if newAttr is from a different document, or if newAttr is already an attribute of another element.

parameters.name: newAttr
parameters.summary: The attribute node to add to the element.

returns.summary: The attribute that was replaced, or null otherwise.

methods.name: setAttributeNodeNS
methods.summary: Adds a new attribute. Any attribute with the same local name and namespace URI is replaced. Throws an exception if the element is read-only, if newAttr is from a different document, or if newAttr is already an attribute of another element.

parameters.name: newAttr
parameters.summary: The attribute node to add to the element.

returns.summary: The attribute that was replaced, or null otherwise.

methods.name: setAttributeNS
methods.summary: Adds a new attribute. Any attribute with the same local name and namespace URI is present on the element is replaced, with its prefix changed to that of the qualifiedName parameter. Throws an exception if the element is read-only, if the name contains an illegal character, or if the qualified name contains an error.

parameters.name: namespaceURI
parameters.summary: The namespace URI of the attribute.

parameters.name: qualifiedName
parameters.summary: The qualified name of the attribute. If it is malformed, has a prefix and namespaceURI is null, or if the prefix is xml or xmlns but does not correspond to a property defined in the XML or XMLNS specifications, then it contains an error.

parameters.name: value
parameters.summary: The value of the attribute. This is value is not parsed as part of the assignment. Any markup is treated as literal text, and needs to be escaped.

properties.name: tagName
properties.summary: The name of the element, as defined by its tag.

properties.name: text
properties.summary: Content (value) of all text nodes within this node.

properties.name: textContent
properties.summary: Content (value) of all text nodes within this node.
properties.description: On Android, textContent is supported on Titanium.XML.Element and Titanium.XML.Text nodes only.
